text:
Charles Otto Puth Jr. (; born December 2, 1991) is an American singer-songwriter and record producer. His song "See You Again" was released as Puth's debut single in 2015. His debut single "Marvin Gaye", which featured vocals from Meghan Trainor. The song topped charts in New Zealand, Ireland, and the United Kingdom.
In 2017, he released two songs, "Attention" and "How Long" from his second studio album, "Voicenotes", with the former peaking at number five on "Billboard" Hot 100.
